sen.j: 密陀絵（みつだえ）は、絵画技法の一つ。
sen.e: The term "Mitsuda-e" refers to a kind of painting technique.
The term "Mitsuda-e" refers to a kind of painting technique.
The term "Mitsuda-e" refers to a kind of painting technique.

sen.j: また、その技法で製作された絵。
sen.e: It also refers to a painting drawn with this technique.
It also refers to a painting drawn with this technique.
It also refers to a painting drawn with this technique.

sen.j: 近世では、乾燥剤として密陀僧を用いた漆器の装飾技法を云う。
sen.e: The term referred to a technique to decorate a lacquer ware by using Mitsuda-so (lead monoxide) as a desiccant in the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The term referred to a technique to decorate a lacquer ware by using Mitsuda-so (lead monoxide) as a desiccant in the early-modern times.
The term referred to a technique to decorate a lacquer ware by using Mitsuda-so (lead monoxide) as a desiccant in the early-modern times.

sen.j: だが、明治時代以降は奈良時代に中国大陸から伝来し、平安時代初期頃までに製作された伝世品を云うようになった。
sen.e: However, since the Meiji period, it has referred to an art object which was created in or before the early Heian period by using the technique introduced from the Chinese continent in the Nara period and has been handed down.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 奈良時代に…伝来し、平安時代初期頃までに製作された: 意味が通じず、翻訳不能なのでWebを確認すると、「奈良時代に…伝来した技術によって平安時代初期頃までに製作された」でしたので、この意味で訳しています(2/5の用語統一リストには「リンクになっている用語が抜けている場合、用語を原文と訳文に補う」とありますが、これはリンクになっている箇所ではない(原文がおかしいため、後日、Web上で文章が修正されたと思われる)ため、原文は訂正しておりません。/ 伝世品: 用語集の訳語は、そのままではこの文脈で使えないので、本文では変更しています。
sen.e: However, since the Meiji period, it has referred to an art object which was created in or before the early Heian period by using the technique introduced from the Chinese continent in the Nara period and has been handed down.

However, since the Meiji period, it has referred to an art object which was created in or before the early Heian period by using the technique introduced from the Chinese continent in the Nara period and has been handed down.

sen.j: 色漆では出し難い白色、淡色など多彩な表現が可能である。
sen.e: It enables a craftsman to express a variety of colors such as white, light colors, etc., which can be hardly expressed by colored lacquer.
sen.cmt: 色漆: 用語集では定訳不明となっていますが、英辞郎に「color lacquer」「colored lacquer(文例で用いられている訳語)」があり、「顔料を加えて色をつけた漆」という語義(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%89%B2%E6%BC%86)から、後者の訳語のほうがよいと判断し、本文に使用しました。
sen.e: It enables a craftsman to express a variety of colors such as white, light colors, etc., which can hardly be expressed by colored lacquer.
sen.cmt: can be hardly→can hardly beに変更
sen.e: It enables a craftsman to express a variety of colors such as white, light colors, etc., which can hardly be expressed by colored lacquer.

tit.e: Yuga (a kind of oil painting with pigment mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil)
Yuga (a kind of oil painting with pigments mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil)
Yuga (a kind of oil painting with pigments mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil)

sen.j: 顔料を密陀油で練った一種の油彩。
sen.e: The term "Yuga" refers to a kind of oil painting with pigment mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil.
The term "Yuga" refers to a kind of oil painting with pigments mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil.
The term "Yuga" refers to a kind of oil painting with pigments mixed with Mitsuda-yu oil.

sen.j: 玉虫厨子、橘夫人厨子などに残る。
sen.e: It remains in Tamamushi-no-Zushi (the "Beetle Shrine" of Horyu-ji), Tachibana Fujin Zushi (zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of (the) Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) of Mrs. Tachibana), etc.
sen.cmt: 橘夫人厨子: 用語集の訳語には説明がないため、「厨子」で登録されている訳語を参考にして、カッコ内に説明を補っています。
sen.e: It remains in Tamamushi-no-Zushi (the "Beetle Shrine" of Horyu-ji), Tachibana Fujin Zushi (Tachibana Shrine), etc.
sen.cmt: 「橘夫人厨子」の説明を「玉虫厨子」に合わせて簡略化
sen.e: It remains in Tamamushi-no-Zushi (the "Beetle Shrine" of Horyu-ji), Tachibana Fujin Zushi (Tachibana Shrine), etc.

tit.e: Yushoku (a luster technique to use glue, pigment and Mitsuda-yu oil)
tit.cmt: 油色: 用語集の訳語は、ここでは合わないため、左記のように訳しています(これは定訳ではありません)。
tit.e: Yushoku (a technique to add luster to a painting by putting oil on its surface)
tit.cmt: 下の説明を重なるため定義を簡略化定訳ではありません
tit.e: Yushoku (a technique to add luster to a painting by putting oil on its surface)

sen.j: 膠と顔料を混ぜて描き密陀油を塗り光沢を出す。
sen.e: The term "Yushoku" refers to a technique to mix glue with pigment for a painting, to which Mitsuda-yu oil is coated to add luster.
The term "Yushoku" refers to a technique of mixing glue with pigments for painting, after which Mitsuda-yu oil is used to coat the surface of the painting to add luster.
The term "Yushoku" refers to a technique of mixing glue with pigments for painting, after which Mitsuda-yu oil is used to coat the surface of the painting to add luster.

sen.j: 正倉院宝物などに残る。
sen.e: It can be observed in the Shoso-in treasures, etc.
It can be observed in the Shoso-in treasures, etc.
It can be observed in the Shoso-in treasures, etc.
